translation.projects_desc: Here you will find my academic, professional, and personal projects.
translation.about_desc2: Passionate about crafting effective, innovative, and creative solutions in development.
translation.about_desc3: Currently in the final semester of a Computer Engineering degree.
translation.about_desc4: Fluent in four languages and always eager to explore new knowledge and skills.
translation.contact_desc: You can find me on GitHub, LinkedIn or send me an email for collaborations or questions.
translation.footer_text: Made with magic and coffee â˜•
translation.resume_desc: Here you can view or download my full resume in PDF format.

projects.title: DoS Attack Detection with Generative AI
projects.description: DoS attack detection using generative AI, my final project at Cefet/RJ

projects.title: Back-end with NestJS
projects.description: Base back-end project using NestJS, TypeORM, and PostgreSQL. Includes JWT authentication, email service, and entity operations.

projects.title: Pacman in Assembly P3
projects.description: Pacman game developed by me in Assembly P3, as part of the Computer Architecture course at CEFET/RJ, for the Computer Engineering program.

projects.title: Linked List Library Management System
projects.description: A Linux-based library system implemented in C using linked lists for efficient memory management. Features student/book/infrastructure tracking with O(n) complexity operations.

projects.title: Parallel Producer-Consumer with fork()
projects.description: Linux-exclusive C implementation demonstrating process-level parallelism using fork(). Features a producer generating data and a consumer processing it through shared memory, developed for academic exploration of basic parallelization concepts.

translation.blog_desc: Check out my posts discussing tutorial videos I publish on YouTube.
translation.blog_post_1_desc: A little self presentation and why nest.js was chosen over other frameworks
translation.blog_post_2_title: Starting Our NestJS Project | Modeling Entities and Explaining Nest Basics
translation.blog_post_2_desc: First steps with NestJS: project setup, modeling initial entities, and explaining the framework fundamentals.
